title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
Do you get the normal 3 start attempts, when plug in the charger?
Did you check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces?
BIOS tested good for sure?
PLT_RESET_L is steady hihg?

If board was affected by liquid, maybe need to reball SMC.
Also try to heat CPU with quality flux; no more than 180-200 degrees, no need to melt the balls.

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
Top to bottom:
* No, it stays on at the second attempt (points to BIOS issue?)
* Checked, all fine.
* I've just tested with a BIOS from the ghostlyhaks repo, without changing ME-region. No difference.
* PLT_RESET_L steady high
* SMC was replaced earlier, made no difference
* CPU heated with Louis' flux, no sigar

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
Link for clean BIOS should be already posted on the forum; didn't check that first?

Was SMC replaced with correct one?

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
* Nope didn't know people share them on here, I'll have a look later
* SMC was replaced by a 820-3437-A while this is a -B board. These are interchangeable right?

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message: Let us know if you found clean BIOS.

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
Possibly CPU area affected by corrosion.
Heat it with quality flux; try to clean eventually crap accumulated underneath.

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message: Do you mean reflow the CPU? Because I already heated the area with flux (see above).

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
Test the board alone on the desk; disconnect any device/cable, apart of 5 pins power.
Use onboard USB for activity test.

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message: Ok, tried that but no activity, so I guess CPU? If so, I'm gonna call fail on this one...

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message:
Could be CPU, or just a knocked off resistor, or broken trace from previous repair attempt.
Working on boards which someone messed before, is a nightmare...

title: 820-3437 Fanspin, no post
message: Yes, tell me about it. Anyway, thanks for your help!
